page.title: 06Dry Stone Walling
page.content: Dry stone walls are a very characteristic feature of the Cotswold countryside. They surround the fields on most of the farms. The man who mends the walls and builds them is a very skilled craftsman. He was taught the craft when he was a lad. He still treasures the stone-cutting tool given to him by the old man who taught him. The stones have to be carefully selected, balanced and laid because no mortar is used to hold them together. He can build 2\ to 3 sq.m.per day which involves moving by hand 6 tons of stone. Dry stone walls are very expensive because they are entirely made by hand but if they are well built they last more than a hundred years.
